intro: Dichaetanthera strigosa, commonly known as the hairy threadgrass, is a perennial grass species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear minute flowers, typical of the Poaceae family. It thrives in grassland habitats and is often found in open, sunny areas. Dichaetanthera strigosa is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystems.
